title: Les Quirk
text:
Leslie Quirk (born 6 March 1965) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1980s and 1990s. He played at club level for <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> and <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a>, as a , i.e. number 2 or 5.
Playing career.
Born in <a href="Ulverston">Ulverston</a>, Quirk started his amateur career at Dalton, and made his professional début for <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a> in 1983. In 1987, he joined <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> for a fee of £55,000.
Quirk played in St. Helens' 15-14 victory over <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="1987%E2%80%9388%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1987–88</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">John Player Special Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1987%E2%80%9388%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1987–88 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 9 January 1988. He also played in two <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> finals at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley</a> for Saints, but was on the losing side on both occasions.
Quirk also represented <a href="Cumbria%20rugby%20league%20team">Cumbria</a>, playing in an 18–13 victory over <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France</a> in October 1988, and a 34–12 victory over <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a> in November 1991.
